user_request: A short poem about a raven that visits a grieving man and repeats one word.

revision_history.draft:
Feathers map constellations—  
each plume a star,  
each shadow a  
constellation.  

The word etches  
into his palm,  
a fossil  
of longing.  

It lingers on his tongue,  
a stone  
in his throat,  
a second skin.  

The raven mirrors  
his grief,  
not as a cry,  
but as a  
reflection.  

Word.  
Word.  
Word.
